name: Embassy Suites Hotel Dallas Love Field

reviews.text: Very nice rooms,separate bedroom.Hotel staff friendly&helpful.My son&I were going to the Cowboys game& paid for the hotel van for transport to the game as did several others.Really appreciated the managers drinks&snacks each nt.{free}.Also the free breakfast was excellent..No complaint about this hotel{even had a indoor pool&gym}.
reviews.title: excellent service&accomodation

reviews.text: We were traveling with our son, daughter-in-law and 4 year old granddaughter. We were very late getting in after an all day travel nightmare and none of us had anything substantial to eat all day. Since our flight departing Miami had us arriving at Dallas Love Field after 10:30 p.m. I called ahead to the hotel and arranged to have food waiting upon our arrival so that our granddaughter would not have to go to bed without dinner. The staff were very accommodating and went out or their way to insure we had a great meal waiting in our rooms for us when we arrived. The front desk representative was incredibly pleasant and checked us in quickly and efficiently. I would highly recommed this hotel.
reviews.title: Most accommodating staff I have ever experienced!

reviews.text: We spent two nights here in October 2010. We were en route to a wedding in San Antonio but stayed on in Dallas for a concert. I chose Embassy Suites as we like the suites as with young kids it makes it easier to have some space, especially with jet lag. The rooms were as ever comfortable and clean. Our suite looked over Bachmann Trail which is a green park and hiking area which was a lovely plus. As I hate driving in the USA we didnt hire a car so were reliant on cans. The hotel however provided a shuttle, not just to the airport but to a mall about 20 mins away. Both drivers (Richard and Oscar) were lovely and came to collect us on request! Richard also very kindly arranged a cab to take us to a concert and ensured the same driver came and collected us afterwards. This ensured we had a great night with no worroes about getting the 20 miles back to the hotel. As ever the food was good and the evening reception margaritas were so nice I was tempted to ditch the wedding in san Antonio and stay in Dallas! Overall a great stay with no issues whatsoever.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay.
Old, tired and dirty
reviews.text: I stayed for the second time at the Embassy Suites Love Field. Great location and staff is friendly, but the hotel is dirty, tired and old. Hairs in sink, dusty room, grimmy walls and floors, and the style is alike a throw back to the 80's. I am sure it was very nice then. Please renovate soon and clean it up!
But nice gardens outside.
reviews.title: Perfrect if you're doing business near Love Field

reviews.text: This hotel was recommended by a couple of friends that travel to Dallas frequently becuase of its location by Love field, and also because of its staf and awesome breakfast omeletes. Of course we also liked the free managers happy hour with a full bar. But the staff really was friendly and genuinely helpful in every encounter. I guess the only thing that we could say we didnt like is that some of the furniture in the lobby is a little dated and worn, though not too bad. But our suite was perfect, nice furnishings, good water pressure (a pet peeve of my husband) and plenty of space. we recommedn this place and will defintiely come back there in our next trip to Dallas.
reviews.title: Delightfully pleasant, clean, friendly and comfortable

reviews.text: We had to stay somewhere for a week between two weekend events we were in Dallas for. We chose this place after reading other reviews here. It really delivered. Despite it's proximity to the Love Field runways, we never heard a single plane take off. It is so quiet. Excellent place for professionals.
reviews.title: Great, quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Embassy suites in Dallas was a great experience. The Hotel was Immaculate, The Food was good, The atmosphere was great. If the staff was on par the stay would have been second to none. There is a great Managers reception each evening with Drinks, snacks and plenty of scenery.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Staff just OK

reviews.text: The employees are very courteous, friendly, and helpful. Breakfast and the manager's reception are great ways to start and end the day. Shuttle service to and from Love Field is timely and regular. A jogging trail that begins at the hotel goes under the busy streets and circles nearby Bachman Lake, which is a great place to walk or jog. This hotel differs from a typical Embassy Suites in that it seems to cater and appeal more to business travelers than families with a bunch of kids, so it is much quieter than one might expect. The exercise room is a bit cramped.
reviews.title: Has everything a business traveler might want or need.

reviews.text: Good hotel with nice, updated rooms. Decent sized area for breakfast and happy hour. The restaurant in the hotel is ok, but there's a number of better restaurants nearby. Plenty of (free) parking in the lot outside. They charge for internet access unless you have Gold or Platinum Hilton status, which is a annoying.
reviews.title: Nice rooms

reviews.text: Both my husband and I were lecturing in Dallas, and found the location excellent, the service excellent and the room comfortable. We particularly liked the pool, open late for post-lecture debriefing and relaxing.. My only complaints are the lack of free high speed internet and a round-the-clock coffee pot, a feature you get in the Hamptons.
reviews.title: Convenience combined with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip was for a little weekend getaway in Dallas. We stayed here for 3 nights. I'm very picky when it comes to choosing a hotel, and I was not disappointed. It is located in a good area of town, I would feel safe taking a walk around the area of the hotel. We parked in the parking garage under the hotel which I liked, felt my vehicle was very safe. They have a security guard inside the hotel overnight. It was located closer to most things in Dallas than I thought it would be. Only 10 minutes to the Galleria or 10 minutes to downtown Dallas(depending on traffic of coure, we traveled at non peak times), only took about 20 minutes to get to Pete's in Addison. We originally got a room on the 2nd floor and we like to stay on high floors, they were happy to put us on the 6th floor. The rooms are spacious and plenty big enough for the two of us. Something important to every traveler, the rooms were very clean, bathroom was very clean as well as the bedding. I found the top off of a deoderant stick under the bed when leaving the room, but no biggie. Roomservice did a good job and provided turndown service and towels everyday. My two favorite things about this hotel, the breakfast and manager's reception. The breakfast is great, best I have ever had in a hotel. We never really needed to eat lunch because of the big breakfast. Omlelets made to order, eggs, potatoes, hotcakes, sausage, bacon, yum! Plus having the typical cereal, fruit, yougert available. The manager's reception serves free beer, wine, and mixed drinks from 5:30-7:30 every night in the Atrium. Sunday night for some reason it was served in the bar. The selection is a bit limited but you can get most drinks you want, but it's not a free full bar. They mostly serve cheper acohol, but for free I didn't complain. My girlfriend said it was one of the best margritas she every had, and thats her drink of choice, I stuck to Jim Beem and coke. We did drink at the bar one evening, and the bartender was friendly and drink prices were on par with most other places. Overall we loved our stay!!
reviews.title: Would stay again and again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three things that could have been better but are not deal breakers
reviews.title: Fantastic suites and great atrium inside hotel
Weekend Getaway
reviews.text: 1. The bed was confortable but could have been better, I've had those pillow top beds at hotels priced the same as this one that were extremely comfortable, if this hotel had those it would have been perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Might be personal preference, but I like having a fan in the bathroom and non fogging mirror, didn't have either
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.text: I found this place on TripAdvisor and what is mentioned is very true. Great location and rooms were spacious and clean. Used the fitness center one morning and checked out the Steam Room in the adjacent pool area. Went and had the omelet to order breakfast in the Am and the staff was very friendly as well. All in all, if you are in town for a night or two on business or pleasure or just passing through, this is definately a clean and safe place to stay at!
reviews.title: Nice spot!

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel, with a wonderful group of staff and the views are amazing along with the breakfast and the area this hotel is around. I was in town to site see and this hotel was perfect.
reviews.title: Amazing staff and wonderful Town

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights during spring break and my biggest thing is customer service...when we arrived the lady at the front counter was not at all kind...I have stayed at other Embassy Suites and this one was by far my least favorite....we actually left and went to stay at the one in Grapevine! They had security walking around, which I completly understand but for that security guard to approach me and my children at the pool to ask if those were my kids was offending....we were not disturbing nor bothering anyone for that matter....I would only suggest staying at another one....I love Embassy Suites and will continue staying loyal to them but I will NOT ever return to this one....
reviews.title: Nice but not as impressive as other Embassy Suites

reviews.text: I thought this hotel was great-close to many fun places to go, close to the airport, and a comfortable bed with nice linens! Parking is all in front and very accessible, and the staff was very friendly. Also, this hotel is kid friendly, however, we never heard any disturbances and the room was quiet and comfortable. This Embassy Suites also has a little snack hour around 6:00 p.m. which is nice too.
reviews.title: Great stay, clean, and service was prompt when more pillows were needed!

reviews.text: My wife, daughter (age 7), and I came to Dallas for a leisure/educational spring break. Principally, we planed to visit the Arboretum, the Dallas Museum of Art (including Nasher), the World Aquarium, and the Dallas Zoo. I wanted nice amenities, safety, and a central location, all within a reasonable price range. This Embassy Suite fit my needs exceptionally well. When you factored in the fact that you don't have to pay for valet parking (like alot of hotels in downtown Dallas), and you get a quality breakfast (cooked to order, not a cold cereal / danish bar) the quality vs economy was very well balanced. The room was spacious, with two TV's, so my wife could watch the season final of The Bachelor in the sitting room, while my daughter watched Nickelodeon in the bedroom. The mini frig. and microwave were a plus, as was the indoor pool. And while I could actually look out our bedroom window and watch departing jet traffic from Dallas Love Field, I found our room exceptionaly quiet. I found the staff to be engaging, the facilities to be pleasing, and the room accommodating. I have stayed at Hotels in Dallas before, only $30.00 to $40.00 dollars cheaper per night , where you were not certain your car was still going to be there in the morning. When you factor in the cost of a comparable breakfast for two adults and one child at a IHOP, your net gain of staying at a cheap hotel is near zero. My family and I look forward to staying here again.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

description: Centrally located in Dallas, the Embassy Suites Hotel is convenient to the downtown business district, as well as a host of area attractions. Complimentary onsite parking, complimentary shuttle to/from Dallas Love Field Airport, North Park Shopping Center, SMU and local businesses within 5 mile radius - Based on availability. Our guest rooms are two-room suites which include complimetary cooked-to-order breakfast and evening cocktails in the garden atrium. The hotel also features an indoor swimming pool, sauna, steam room, whirlpool, fitness center and outdoor jogging trail. So, whether here for business or pleasure, the Embassy Suites will make each stay one to remember.
